Dear Paris Marie Miller:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff scream and yell at the residents.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 08/23/2023. It states that evening and
night staff are screaming at and telling youth to shut up making
them feel sad. Complainant reports no other additional
information to the allegations.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 08/28/2023. He reports Staff
Person 1 often telling the residents, “If you’re not going to shut up”
and sounds harsh when she addresses the group. He reports
recently another unknown resident being in the wrong for
something and that Staff Person 1 was not supportive and
appeared to instigate the resident and group. Youth A states
Youth A has not outwardly sworn at the residents. Youth A
reports that he often gets a headache when in the presence of
Staff Person 1 and notes that Staff Person 1 is newer. Youth A
does not report any other staff as yelling at them.
I interviewed Youth B onsite on 08/28/2023. He reports Staff
Person 1 as being low-tempered meaning that she is quick to
anger. He reports Staff Person 1 has participated in group with
him and others and that she often speaks sternly and does yell at
them though does not use profanity with them. Youth B reports
Staff Person 1 appears to instigate set up other residents during
group which he states is counterproductive. Youth B does not
report any other staff as yelling at them.
I interviewed Youth C onsite on 08/28/2023. He reports Staff
Person 1 is respectful of the residents though reports she often
uses a loud voice when residents are not following directives. He
reports her loud direct voice doesn’t help the group as it tends to
only anger other residents including himself.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 via telephone on 09/01/2023. She
reports being employed by the facility since 04/2023 and attended
orientation with no disciplinary actions. She recalls Youth A
recently mentioning that he was “sick and tired” of staff yelling and
notes that staff must be careful speaking with youth who have
mental health issues. Staff Person 1 reports that she always
2

speaks mildly with the residents and denies saying “Shut up”
though has come close to it and goes on to report that she “Keeps
things real” with the residents. Staff Person 1 reports not
observing any staff yelling at the residents. Upon conclusion of
the interview Staff Person 1 is noted as questioning how Chief
Administrator could see or hear anything stating that she was
upstairs. During the interview that Staff Person 1 spoke in a quick
and erratic manner with fluctuating vocal patterns.
I interviewed Chief Administrator onsite on 08/28/2023. She
reports Staff Person 1 being a newer staff being hired on
04/24/2023 and receiving orientation on the same day. She
recalls one evening hearing a harsh sounding voice from her
second-floor office and walking downstairs to see what was
occurring. She reports Staff Person 1 was present and engaging
in programming with the residents. Chief Administrator reports
Staff Person 1 does have a tendency of engaging with the
residents with a harsh tone and states she will be extending Staff
Person 1’s probationary period and increase her supervision.
Analysis Consistent youth reports indicate that Staff Person 1 yells at the
residents to include the use of a harsh tone especially when
agitated. Staff Person 1’s harsh tone is not supportive in nature
which instigates the residents to behaviorally act out or become
angered.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
